Ray III, recently told members of the U.S. Congress that Joseph Bankman and ‚Äúthe family certainly received payments‚Äù from FTX.
SBF‚Äôs Ethics-Obsessed Parents Face Scrutiny Over Their Alleged Ties With FTX Operations
On Saturday, a report from Reuters detailed that the FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) will likely surrender to a U.S. extradition request, after it was initially reported that SBF would fight extradition to the United States. Reports detail that SBF‚Äôs parents, who are reportedly ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Nigeria Looking To Legalize Bitcoin Usage: Report
entry.summary:
If passed, the reported amendments would regulate bitcoin and cryptocurrency usage in the African nation. A local Nigerian newspaper has reported that Babangida Ibrahim, chairman of the House of Representatives Committee on Capital Market and Institutions of Nigeria, claimed the country will soon pass a law making the usage of bitcoin and cryptocurrencies legal. The bill would amend the 2007 Investments and Securities Act and would recognize bitcoin as legal capital for investment. Back in February of 2021, Nigeria effectively banned the usage of bitcoin with a letter prohibiting regulated financial businesses from ‚Äúdealing‚Äù with cryptocurrencies. In the same year, Bitcoin Magazine reported Nigeria soaring to the largest volume of bitcoin peer-to-peer trading in the world, and Chainanalysis reports showed that Nigeria had greatly accelerated bitcoin adoption.
The newspaper report described how Ibrahim pointed to Nigeria being behind in regards to regulation of the industry, saying ‚ÄúLike I said earlier during the second reading, we need an efficient and vibrant capital market in Nigeria. For us to do that, we have to be up to date global practices.‚Äù If the proposed regulation properly addresses the growing bitcoin usage within the country, it could be a major catalyst for the African continent‚Äôs most populated country. Bitcoin has had a large presence in the country despite the current ban, including the construction of a Bitcoin village, Nigerian Bitcoiners participating in all sorts of development, philanthropic work from Bitcoin companies and mining being an active industry there.

While Miners Deal With Low BTC Prices, Bitcoin‚Äôs Mining Difficulty Target Expected to Increase 3% Higher
entry.summary:
Bitcoin‚Äôs mining difficulty target is expected to increase on Dec. 19, 2022, after printing the largest reduction recorded in 2022 on Dec. 5, at block height 766,080. During the last 2,016 blocks, Bitcoin‚Äôs hashrate has been around 254.3 exahash per second (EH/s), and block intervals have been faster at 9:41 minutes per block.
Bitcoin‚Äôs Difficulty Expected to Jump 3% Higher on Dec. 19, Bitcoin Average Mining Costs Are Higher Than the Current Spot Market Value
In roughly 24 hours, the Bitcoin network will experience another difficulty transition, and this time around it is estimated to increase. The increase is estimated to be around 3.2% to 3.76% higher than the current 34.24 trillion value. The rise would lift the 34.24 trillion to around 35.53 trillion on or around Dec. 19, 2022.
D‚Ä¶

entry.title: Onecoin Co-Founder Pleads Guilty to Fraud Charges in US
entry.summary:
Karl Sebastian Greenwood, a co-founder and operator of Onecoin, has pled guilty to his part in building the notorious crypto pyramid. The fake cryptocurrency‚Äôs ‚Äúglobal master distributor‚Äù has been in custody since 2018 when he was arrested in Thailand and extradited to the United States.
Cryptoqueen‚Äôs Partner at Onecoin Admits Role in Multimillion-Dollar Fraud
Co-founder of Onecoin Karl Sebastian Greenwood pled guilty in Manhattan federal court to wire fraud and money laundering charges on Friday. As a result of misrepresentations made by him, the Ponzi scheme‚Äôs mastermind, ‚ÄòCryptoqueen‚Äô Ruja Ignatova, and others, victims from around the world, including the U.S., invested billions of dollars into the fraudulent platform.

entry.title: Silvergate Capital Slapped With Lawsuit Over Ties With FTX And Alameda
entry.summary:
Several events are still unfolding following the collapse of FTX crypto exchange. The contagion from the exchange‚Äôs sudden collapse created panic among other crypto companies, especially those with exposure to the Sam Bankman-fried led exchange. Also, the shutdown of its sister company, Alameda Research, only added to the paranoia.
Silvergate Capital is one of the companies that is now in hot water, including Silvergate Bank and Silvergate Capital CEO Alan Lane, who are all facing a class-action suit for their connection with FTX.
Silvergate Capital is California-based Silvergate Bank‚Äôs parent company.¬†The lawsuit was filed in the California Southern District Court.
Silvergate Aided Fraudulent Actions Of FTX, Lawsuit Claims
The case accuses Silvergate for keeping FTX users‚Äô d‚Ä¶

The world‚Äôs largest exchange for crypto assets, Binance, is ready to provide support to the Central Bank of Azerbaijan (CBA) in elaborating mechanisms for crypto regulation, the company‚Äôs Director of Governmental Relations in the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) Olga Goncharova told local media.

entry.title: Ghanaian Cedi Appreciates by More Than 30% in 4 Days ‚Äî Currency Recovery Follows IMF Loan Announcement
entry.summary:
Just a few months after it became the world‚Äôs worst-performing currency, the Ghanaian cedi‚Äôs exchange rate versus the U.S. dollar bounced back from just over 14 units per dollar on Dec. 1, to 8 units for every dollar by Dec. 16, new data has shown. The currency‚Äôs resurgence appears to have been fueled by reports that Ghana has secured a $3 billion loan from the International Monetary Fund (IMF).
Cedi Appreciates by Over 36% in Just Four Days
After tapping an all-time low of more than 14 cedis for every dollar, the Ghanaian currency‚Äôs exchange rate versus the U.S. dollar appreciated to 8 cedis per dollar by Dec. 16, the latest data from the Bank of Ghana (BOG) has shown. According to the BOG data, the most rapid recovery occurred between Dec. 12 and Dec. 16 when the cedi appreciated by‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Corner: The Sports Slice
entry.summary:
One of the biggest stages in sports is approaching it‚Äôs final match, as France and Argentina are set to face off in a storyline matchup on Sunday. Argentinian Lionel Messi sets to bring home his first World Cup championship despite a storied career, but will need to overcome a powerful France squad that has given up just a single goal throughout the tournament.
Meanwhile, crypto partnerships in sport seem to have a damper on them that hasn‚Äôt been seen since pre-2021 bull run, before big dollar spending in sport sponsorship was nearly as prominent as it is today.
As the market has cooled, so too have the sports deals. Let‚Äôs take a look at the activity across sports and crypto over the past week.

PRESS RELEASE. In December 2022, CoinEx will celebrate its fifth birthday. Since its inception, the crypto exchange has gone through bulls and bears and attracted over four million users across more than 200 countries and regions worldwide. The CoinEx team shared their views on the future development of crypto and the exchange.
CoinEx is one of the few crypto exchanges that has been running for five straight years. In your view, what is the most prominent change in the market over that period?

Monetary Authority of Kazakhstan Reports on Advance of Digital Tenge Pilot Project
The National Bank of Kazakhstan (NBK) has announced the successful completion of the second stage of testing of the platform for its central bank digital currency (CBDC). The results of the trials and the study on the need for the new version of the national fiat, the tenge, have been presented in a whitepaper published by the regulator.

G20 Nations Discuss Crypto Regulation
The G20 finance and central bank deputies met for the first time under India‚Äôs presidency on Dec. 13-15 in Bengaluru.
Ajay Seth, India‚Äôs economic affairs secretary, said at a news conference Wednesday that the G20 nations aim to build a policy consensus on crypto assets for better global regulation. entry.title: US Senator: Cryptocurrency Cannot Be Stopped, FTX Collapse Isn‚Äôt an Indictment of Crypto
entry.summary:
U.S. Senator Pat Toomey says illegal actions by crypto exchange FTX must be separated ‚Äúfrom perfectly lawful and innovative cryptocurrencies.‚Äù Emphasizing that ‚ÄúThe collapse of FTX is not an indictment of crypto,‚Äù he noted that ‚Äúcryptocurrency cannot be stopped‚Äù and ‚Äúthe technology would simply migrate offshore‚Äù if Congress tried.
Separating Illegal Actions From ‚ÄòPerfectly Lawful and Innovative Cryptocurrencies‚Äô
U.S. Senator Pat Toomey (R-PA) explained in his opening statement at the Senate Banking Committee hearing Wednesday that the collapse of crypto exchange FTX is not an indictment against cryptocurrency.

entry.title: Why a Payload of NFTs Was Just Sent to the International Space Station
entry.summary: Dreambound Orbital's first mission today sees a trove of NFTs from Magic Eden, World of Women, and other projects orbit the Earth.

entry.title: Flow Hits New Low After NFT Trading Craters, Dapper Downsizes
entry.summary: Flow is now down 26% over the last 30 days, coinciding with falling NFT activity on the platform and Dapper Labs‚Äô recent layoffs.

entry.title: New York Banking Regulator Sets Crypto Guidelines in Wake of FTX
entry.summary: Banks in the state must now submit a business plan to the NYDFS if they want to deal with crypto.

entry.title: Donald Trump Now Has an NFT Collection‚ÄîAnd Crypto Twitter 'Can‚Äôt Even'
entry.summary: The former U.S. president is selling $99 digital trading cards that show him as a superhero, astronaut, and more.

entry.title: UN Taps Stellar Blockchain to Send War-Impacted Ukrainians USDC Stablecoins
entry.summary: The UN Refugee Agency is turning to crypto to aid internally displaced persons and other war-affected people in Ukraine.

entry.title: New Coinbase Tool to Let Users Reclaim Stranded Ethereum Tokens
entry.summary: Untold numbers of ERC-20 tokens have been lost due to Coinbase incompatibility with the exchange‚Äîa new feature will finally retrieve them.

entry.title: BitGo ‚ÄòHeld Up‚Äô Alameda's $50M Wrapped Bitcoin Withdrawal Requests
entry.summary: The BitGo CEO said the withdrawal requests came as Sam Bankman-Fried petitioned investors for capital before announcing FTX's bankruptcy.

entry.title: France Mulls Full-Licensing Regime for Crypto Firms Citing FTX Bankruptcy
entry.summary: Current rules in France give crypto firms the option, but not the necessity, to gain a full license. That may soon change.

entry.title: Crypto Derivatives Platform Paradigm Slashes Salaries to ‚ÄòReduce Need for Layoffs‚Äô
entry.summary: The crypto derivatives platform Paradigm today announced that it was slashing employees' salaries amid the dismal crypto market.

entry.title: Cathie Wood's Ark Invest Snaps Up Another $11.9M in Coinbase Stock
entry.summary: Ark Investment‚Äôs funds scooped up another 297,000 shares in America‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase on Wednesday.

entry.title: FTX Digital Exec Tipped Off Bahamian Authorities About Funds Sent to Alameda
entry.summary: Ryan Salame flagged transfers of customer funds from FTX to Alameda to Bahamian authorities just two days before FTX filed bankruptcy.

entry.title: Binance Deliberately Caused FTX Collapse: Kevin O‚ÄôLeary
entry.summary: The star of ‚ÄúShark Tank‚Äù had some strong words for the exchange at the FTX hearing in the U.S. Senate today.

entry.title: Justice Department Charges Nine in Crypto Ponzi Schemes
entry.summary: The founders of IcomTech and Weltsys "presented a life of luxury," and now stand accused of conspiracy to commit fraud and money laundering.

entry.title: White House Refuses to Answer Questions About Sam Bankman-Fried Donations
entry.summary: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre claimed she was bound from commenting on the matter by a Depression-era law.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Drop Sharply After Fed Signals More Interest Rate Hikes to Come
entry.summary: Bitcoin nosedived following the central bank‚Äôs decision to raise rates by 50 basis points.

entry.title: gm: Tezos Co-Founder Kathleen Breitman Sounds Off on FTX Collapse
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman has been in crypto since the beginning and has seen a lot of cycles and failures. She joined Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts and brought the fire on FTX and Sam Bankman-Fried‚Äôs mismanagement, ‚Äúdecentralization theater,‚Äù Tezos‚Äôs reputation and positioning, crypto sports marketing, and NFTs. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Raising in a Bear Market: Slow Ventures, Volt Capital, Conviction, AngelBlock at 0xpo Summit
entry.summary: Clay Robbins of Slow Ventures, Soona Amhaz of Volt Capital, Sarah Guo of Conviction and formerly Greylock, and Alex Strzesniewski of AngelBlock joined Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Summit in San Francisco on November 3 for an extensive panel on raising venture money even during Crypto Winter.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Bored Ape Yacht Club Wins NFT Project of the Year
entry.summary: Illa Da Producer accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Yuga Labs from presenter Alanna Roazzi-Laforet at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Moonbirds, Azuki, DeGods, and CloneX.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Art Blocks Founder Wins Industry Achievement Award
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon accepted the industry achievement award from presenter Clara Tsao of Filecoin Foundation at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: BFF Wins Diversity Award
entry.summary: Rachel Weiss and Jackie Courtney accepted the Cryptie for BFF from presenter Rebecca Barkin of Lamina1 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were WomenRise, Boys Club, and The Hug.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Crypto Unicorns Wins Game of the Year
entry.summary: Katrina Wolfe accepted the Cryptie for Crypto Unicorns from presenter Avery Akkineni of Vayner3 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Stepn, Zed Run, and Blankos Block Party.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Celo Wins Social Impact Award
entry.summary: Marek Olszewski accepted the Cryptie for Celo from presenter Dan Roberts of Decrypt Media at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Ukraine DAO, Dream DAO, Proof of Protest, and Digital Diaspora.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: People of Crypto Wins Metaverse Event of the Year
entry.summary: Simone Berry and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie for People of Crypto's Metaverse Pride Parade from presenter Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Doodles Collab With Shopify Wins Mainstream Award
entry.summary: Shirley Cedeno and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Doodles from presenters Igor Lilic and Gabriela Ramos Lilic of Breakout at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were RTFKT and Nike, Gmoney and Adidas, Tiffany and CryptoPunks, and TIMEpieces.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year
entry.summary: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year
entry.summary: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.

entry.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's business‚Äîplus misconceptions in the crypto space.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what he‚Äôs looking forward to in Web3.

entry.title: NFT Storytelling: Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry, Artemysia-X, Kas Vegas at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: "Lost Children of Andromeda" author Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry of Metagood and ACTAI Ventures, Artemysia-X of Rug Radio program LorePlay, and Kas Vegas of NFT INT, Huxley, and Feature.io all discussed how their work utilizes NFTs for storytelling, on a lively panel at Camp Decrypt moderated by What's Trending podcast host Shira Lazar.
